intro: Euphrasia pygmaea, commonly known as the dwarf eyebright, is a small herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, hairy stems and clusters of small, yellowish-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, preferring well-drained soils and full sunlight. Euphrasia pygmaea is known for its medicinal properties, with the leaves and flowers used in traditional herbal remedies. Its short stature and vibrant flowers make it a distinctive and ornamental species in its native environment.
